This is a nice puzzle game to play when you're bored. It works your brain but it's also something semi-chill where you can try to solve puzzles (some easy, some not) while talking to friends, watching TV/Youtube, or listening to music (which I do for most games I play, but this is a nice background game). It's also so fun, the graphics, the playstyle, and the game, in general, is great. And I absolutely love Wheatley.

It requires you to think laterally, i.e. the solution is not always "straight ahead."  It also does not rely on youthful eye-hand cordination, barring you from progressing just because you're not quick enough.  The graphics are good and there is a sense of playfulness about the entry environment.
